00017   namespace boost { namespace reflect {
00018     /**
00019      *  @brief Specialized to mirror the member 
00020      *         variable/method pointed to by MemberPtr
00021      */
00022     template<typename MemberPtr>
00023     struct mirror_member{};
00024     
00025     /**
00026      *  @brief Interface Delegate that mirrors the 
00027      *         reflected interface without any transformation.
00028      *  
00029      *  To specialize how a particular member is mirrored define
00030      *  the partial specialization of mirror_member for your type.
00031      *
00032      *  @code
00033      *  template<typename Type, typename Class>
00034      *  mirror_member<Type(Class::*)> 
00035      *  @endcode
00036      */
00037     struct mirror_interface 
00038     {
00039       /**
00040        * @brief Implements the InterfaceDelegate meta-function to 
00041        *      determine what type to create to mirror MemberPointer 
00042        *      in boost::reflect::vtable used by boost::reflect::any_ptr
00043        */
00044       template<typename MemberPointer>
00045       struct calculate_type {
00046         typedef mirror_member<MemberPointer>  type; 
00047       };
00048       
00049       #ifndef DOXYGEN
00050       template<typename T>
00051       class set_visitor {
00052         public:
00053           set_visitor( T* self = 0)
00054           :m_self(self){}
00055 
00056           template<typename InterfaceName, typename M>
00057           bool accept( M& m, const char* name ) {
00058             assign<M> a(m_self,m);
00059             M::template get_member_ptr<T>( a );
00060             return true;
00061           }
00062         private:
00063           template<typename Member>
00064           struct assign {
00065             assign( T* _v, Member& _m ):v(_v),m(_m){}
00066 
00067             template<typename MemberPtr>
00068             void operator=( const MemberPtr& p ) {
00069               m.set_delegate( v, p );
00070             }
00071             private:
00072               T*      v;
00073               Member& m;
00074           };
00075           T* m_self;
00076       };
00077       #endif 
00078     };
00079 
00080     #ifndef DOXYGEN
00081     /**
00082      *  Blocks a signal if it is currently unblocked and 
00083      *  unblocks it when it goes out of scope if it was blocked
00084      *  when constructed. 
00085      */
00086     struct scoped_block_signal {
00087       scoped_block_signal( boost::signals::connection& _c )
00088       :c(_c),unblock(false){ 
00089         if( c != boost::signals::connection() && !c.blocked() )  {
00090           unblock = true;
00091           c.block();
00092         }
00093       }
00094       ~scoped_block_signal() { 
00095         if( unblock && c != boost::signals::connection() ) 
00096             c.unblock(); 
00097       }
00098       private:
00099         bool                        unblock;
00100         boost::signals::connection& c; 
00101     };
00102     #endif

00105   #define PARAM_NAME(z,n,type)         BOOST_PP_CAT(a,n)
00106   #define PARAM_PLACE_HOLDER(z,n,type) BOOST_PP_CAT(_,BOOST_PP_ADD(n,1) )
00107   #define PARAM_TYPE_NAME(z,n,type)   BOOST_PP_CAT(typename A,n)
00108   #define PARAM_TYPE(z,n,type)   BOOST_PP_CAT(A,n)
00109   #define PARAM_ARG(z,n,type)     PARAM_TYPE(z,n,type) PARAM_NAME(z,n,type)

00129 #define n BOOST_PP_ITERATION()
00130 #define PARAM_NAMES          BOOST_PP_ENUM(n,PARAM_NAME,A) // name_N
00131 #define PARAM_PLACE_HOLDERS  BOOST_PP_ENUM_TRAILING(n,PARAM_PLACE_HOLDER,A) // _(N+1)
00132 #define PARAM_ARGS           BOOST_PP_ENUM(n,PARAM_ARG,A) // TYPE_N name_N
00133 #define PARAM_TYPE_NAMES     BOOST_PP_ENUM(n,PARAM_TYPE_NAME,A) // typename TYPE_N
00134 #define PARAM_TYPES          BOOST_PP_ENUM(n,PARAM_TYPE,A) // TYPE_N
00135 
00136 template<typename R, typename Class BOOST_PP_COMMA_IF(n) PARAM_TYPE_NAMES>
00137 struct mirror_member<R(Class::*)(PARAM_TYPES)const> 
00138 {
00139   // boost::result_of
00140   typedef typename adapt_void<R>::result_type                    result_type;
00141   typedef mirror_member                                          self_type;
00142   typedef boost::fusion::vector<PARAM_TYPES>                     fused_params;
00143   typedef boost::function_traits<result_type(PARAM_TYPES)>       traits;
00144   static const bool                                              is_const = true;
00145   static const bool                                              is_signal = false;
00146 
00147   typedef typename boost::remove_pointer<result_type(*)(PARAM_TYPES)>::type   signature;
00148 
00149   result_type operator()( PARAM_ARGS )const {
00150     return m_delegate( boost::ref( boost::fusion::make_vector(PARAM_NAMES) ) );
00151   }
00152   result_type operator() ( const fused_params& fp )const {
00153     return m_delegate( fp );
00154   }
00155   mirror_member& operator=( const mirror_member& d )  {
00156     m_delegate = d.m_delegate;
00157     return *this;
00158   }
00159   template<typename T>
00160   mirror_member& operator=( const T& d )  {
00161     m_delegate = adapt_void<R,T>(d);
00162     return *this;
00163   }
00164   template<typename C, typename M>
00165   void set_delegate(  C*& s, const M& m ) {
00166     m_delegate = adapt_void<R, boost::function<R(const fused_params&)> >(
00167                     boost::fusion::make_fused_function_object( 
00168                                     boost::bind(m,s PARAM_PLACE_HOLDERS ) ));
00169   }
00170   private:
00171     boost::function<result_type(const fused_params&)> m_delegate; 
00172 };
00173 
00174 template<typename R, typename Class  BOOST_PP_COMMA_IF(n) PARAM_TYPE_NAMES>
00175 struct mirror_member<R(Class::*)(PARAM_TYPES)> 
00176 {
00177   typedef typename adapt_void<R>::result_type                result_type;
00178                                                                                        
00179   typedef mirror_member                                      self_type;
00180   typedef boost::fusion::vector<PARAM_TYPES>                 fused_params;
00181   typedef boost::function_traits<R(PARAM_TYPES)>             traits;
00182   typedef boost::function<result_type(const fused_params&)>  delegate_type;
00183   static const bool                                          is_const  = false;
00184   static const bool                                          is_signal = false;
00185 
00186   // boost::result_of
00187   typedef typename boost::remove_pointer<result_type(*)(PARAM_TYPES)>::type signature;
00188 
00189   result_type operator()( PARAM_ARGS ) {
00190     return m_delegate( boost::fusion::make_vector(PARAM_NAMES) );
00191   }
00192   result_type operator() ( const fused_params& fp ) {
00193     return m_delegate( fp );
00194   }
00195   template<typename T>
00196   mirror_member& operator=( const T& d )  {
00197     m_delegate = adapt_void<R,T>(d);
00198     return *this;
00199   }
00200   template<typename C, typename M>
00201   void set_delegate(  C*& s, M m ) {
00202     m_delegate = adapt_void<R, boost::function<R(const fused_params&)> >(
00203                       boost::fusion::make_fused_function_object( 
00204                                        boost::bind(m,s PARAM_PLACE_HOLDERS ) ));
00205   }
00206   private:
00207     delegate_type m_delegate; 
00208 };

00210 
00211 template<typename R, typename Class  BOOST_PP_COMMA_IF(n) PARAM_TYPE_NAMES>
00212 struct mirror_member< boost::signal<R(PARAM_TYPES)> (Class::*) > 
00213 {
00214   typedef typename adapt_void<R>::result_type                result_type;
00215   typedef mirror_member                                      self_type;
00216   typedef boost::fusion::vector<PARAM_TYPES>                 fused_params;
00217   typedef boost::function_traits<result_type(PARAM_TYPES)>   traits;
00218   typedef boost::signal<R(PARAM_TYPES)>                      signal_type;
00219   static const bool                                          is_const = false;
00220   static const bool                                          is_signal = true;
00221 
00222   // boost::result_of
00223   typedef typename boost::remove_pointer<result_type(*)(PARAM_TYPES)>::type   signature;
00224 
00225   result_type operator()( PARAM_ARGS ) {
00226     return (*this)( boost::fusion::make_vector(PARAM_NAMES) );
00227   }
00228 
00229   result_type operator() ( const fused_params& fp ) {
00230     scoped_block_signal block_reverse(m_reverse_con);
00231     if( int(m_signal.num_slots()) - 1 > 0 )  // do not count our reverse connection
00232         boost::fusion::make_fused_function_object( boost::ref(m_signal) )(fp);
00233     return m_delegate( fp );
00234   }
00235 
00236   // emits locally, but does not forward to delegate
00237   result_type emit( const fused_params& fp ) {
00238     scoped_block_signal block_reverse(m_reverse_con);
00239     return adapt_void<R,boost::function<R(const fused_params&)> >(
00240             boost::fusion::make_fused_function_object( boost::ref(m_signal) ) )(fp);
00241   }
00242 
00243   template<typename T>
00244   mirror_member& operator=( const T& d )  {
00245     m_delegate = adapt_void<R,T>(d);
00246     return *this;
00247   }
00248 
00249   template<typename Functor>
00250   boost::signals::connection connect( const Functor& f ) {
00251     boost::signals::connection c = m_signal.connect(adapt_void<R,Functor>(f) );
00252     if( m_connect_delegate )
00253         m_connect_delegate(m_signal.num_slots());
00254     return c;
00255   }
00256   void disconnect( const boost::signals::connection& c ) {
00257     c.disconnect();
00258     if( m_connect_delegate )
00259         m_connect_delegate(m_signal.num_slots());
00260   }
00261 
00262   void set_connect_delegate( const boost::function<void(int)>& f ) {
00263     m_connect_delegate = f;
00264   }
00265 
00266   // sets the delegate that will be called when the signal is 'emited'
00267   template<typename C, typename M>
00268   void set_delegate(  C*& s, M m ) {
00269     m_signal.disconnect_all_slots();
00270     m_reverse_con = 
00271         (s->*m).connect( boost::fusion::make_unfused( 
00272                             boost::bind( &mirror_member::emit, this, _1) )  );
00273 
00274     m_delegate = emit_or_throw( s->*m );
00275   }
00276 
00277   ~mirror_member() {
00278     m_signal.disconnect_all_slots();
00279     if( m_reverse_con != boost::signals::connection() )
00280         m_reverse_con.disconnect();
00281   }
00282 
00283   private:
00284 
00285     struct emit_or_throw {
00286         struct no_connected_slots : public std::exception, public boost::exception {
00287           const char* what()const throw() { return "no connected slots"; }
00288         };
00289         emit_or_throw( signal_type& s ):sig(s){}
00290         result_type operator()( const fused_params& p ) {
00291           if( int(sig.num_slots()) -1 > 0 ) { // do not count our reverse connection
00292             return adapt_void<R, boost::function<R(const fused_params&)> >(
00293                       boost::fusion::make_fused_function_object(boost::ref(sig)))(p);
00294           }
00295           BOOST_THROW_EXCEPTION( no_connected_slots() );
00296         }
00297         signal_type&            sig;
00298     };
00299 
00300     boost::function<void(int)>                         m_connect_delegate;
00301     boost::function<result_type(const fused_params&)>  m_delegate; 
00302     boost::signals::connection                         m_reverse_con;
00303     boost::signal<R(PARAM_TYPES)>                      m_signal;
00304 };
